src: pub(super) struct Drain<'l, 'f, T, const N: usize, F>
doc_adt: See [`Drain::new`]; this is our fake iterator.

VariantIdx(None)-FieldIdx(Some(0)).name: ptr
VariantIdx(None)-FieldIdx(Some(0)).doc:
The pointer to the next element to return, or the past-the-end location
 if the drainer is empty.

 This address will be used for all ZST elements, never changed.
 As we "own" this array, we dont need to store any lifetime.

VariantIdx(None)-FieldIdx(Some(1)).name: end
VariantIdx(None)-FieldIdx(Some(1)).doc:
For non-ZSTs, the non-null pointer to the past-the-end element.
 For ZSTs, this is null.
